articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Phil Stewart, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: Iran did not include mobile launchers with the close-range ballistic missiles that Washington last week accused Tehran of delivering to Russia for use against Ukraine, according to three sources with knowledge of the matter.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran withheld launchers for missiles sent to Russia, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 31 people died in an Israeli airstrike on a Beirut suburb on Friday, the Lebanese health ministry said on Saturday, including three children and seven women, in the deadliest strike in a year of conflict between Hezbollah and Israel.
articles.title: Israeli strike on Beirut on Friday killed 31, Lebanese ministry says

articles.author: Tora Agarwala
articles.description: India's northeastern state of Manipur has been placed on high alert after intelligence reports of a potential influx of 900 suspected Kuki militants from Myanmar, a senior security official said on Friday.
articles.title: India's Manipur on high alert over alleged influx of 900 militants from Myanmar

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinians said an Israeli strike killed at least 22 people in a school sheltering displaced people in southern Gaza City on Saturday, while the Israeli military said the attack targeted a Hamas command centre.
articles.title: Palestinians say Israeli strike killed 22 in shelter, army says it hit militants

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres is "gravely alarmed" by reports of a full-scale assault on the Sudanese city of al-Fashir by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and called on its leader to halt the attack immediately, a U.N. spokesperson said on Saturday.
articles.title: UN chief Guterres 'gravely alarmed' by reports of RSF assault on al-Fashir

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan on Saturday said he was worried about escalation between Israel and Lebanon but that the Israeli killing of a top Hezbollah leader brought justice to the Iran-backed group.
articles.title: Sullivan expresses worry over escalating Israel-Lebanon tension, calls Hezbollah strike as justice served

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's foreign minister said on Saturday that Russia is planning strikes on Ukrainian nuclear facilities before the winter, and urged the U.N.'s nuclear watchdog and Ukraine's allies to establish permanent monitoring missions at the country's nuclear plants.
articles.title: Ukraine says Russia is planning strikes on nuclear facilities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A man shattered a sculpture by Chinese artist and activist Ai Weiwei on Friday during the opening of his exhibition at Palazzo Fava in the Italian city of Bologna, a spokesperson for the show said.
articles.title: Man smashes Ai Weiwei sculpture at Italy art show opening

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Attacks on Lebanon this week showed that the Israeli government planned to spread the war to the region, Turkey's President Tayyip Erdogan said on Saturday, calling on Western countries to take "deterrent steps" against Israel's actions.
articles.title: Turkey calls on West to take 'deterrent steps' against Israeli action

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Ethnic minorities in Bangladesh’s southern hilly region are living in fear after clashes in which four people were killed and dozens wounded, police and witnesses said on Saturday.
articles.title: Fears grip ethnic minorities after deadly violence in Bangladesh
